intro: Chaptalia shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer's chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a subtle fragrance, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Chaptalia shaferi is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
